laboratory_examinations.findings: Episodes of sinus bradycardia with peripheral apnea/hypopnea, suggesting vagal hypertonia.
Episodes of sinus bradycardia with peripheral apnea/hypopnea, suggesting vagal hypertonia.
Isolated hypergonadotropic hypogonadism, no immunodeficiency noted, especially no lymphopenia.
Confirmed the presence of the SRY region.

Extremely pathological with slow, symmetrical, and alternating delta and theta activity; numerous episodes of multifocal, asynchronous, abundant, and diffuse spikes and spikes-waves, predominant in central and occipital regions; almost total absence of stimuli response reflecting severe epileptic encephalopathy.

laboratory_examinations.date: At birth and repeated at age 5 months
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Remained normal when repeated at age 5 months.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Two likely pathogenic variants in TSPYL1 in compound heterozygous state: c.725_726del; p.(Val242Glufs*52) and c.236del; p.(Gly79Valfs*36).
Did not return any additional candidate variants that could explain the epileptic phenotype.
